column5: Don't know how many of you travel through Wawa on your Canada trips, but they had a severe rainstorm that hit just the week before Sandy hit the US. We travel thru Wawa a couple times a season & always stop in town for supplies. Sad to see a town with an already down economy have to go thru this. Sections of Trans-Canada 17 washed away & the Ford dealership lot cut in two !Here's a link to a story & some pictures:http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2012/10...#slide=1692536 Fish
Unbelievable!!!!! This will give work to some locals. Get it repaired before end of May. I am coming North.
Wow. What the water did to that road is just amazing. Good to hear no one was hurt in this event. Mother nature must be tuning up for that Mayan calendar prediction next month!
The hiway is all repaired for now, I was told the motel end is still hanging over the washout.They did a pretty good job of fixing all the roads in such short time.Fisherman 1792
